meanings.definition: Something that is difficult or impossible to understand or explain.
meanings.sent1: The disappearance of the key was a real mystery to the children.
meanings.sent2: The detective was determined to solve the mystery of the missing necklace.
meanings.sent3: The mystery of the vanishing cookies left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden change in behavior was a mystery wrapped in an enigma.
meanings.sent5: The mystery surrounding the old mansion added an air of suspense to the story.

meanings.definition: A novel, play, or movie dealing with a puzzling crime.
meanings.sent1: The students enjoyed reading a mystery novel during their book club.
meanings.sent2: The movie theater was showing a thrilling mystery about a stolen painting.
meanings.sent3: The play turned out to be a comedy instead of a mystery, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The mystery on stage kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent5: The mystery in the book had a surprising twist at the end.

meanings.definition: A person or thing whose identity or nature is puzzling or unknown.
meanings.sent1: The new student was a mystery to the rest of the class.
meanings.sent2: The masked superhero was a mystery to the citizens of the city.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious package left on the doorstep turned out to be a prank.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden appearance at the party was a mystery to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The strange creature in the forest was a mystery waiting to be solved.
